alert.note: Alert for Lewis (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 16 at 10:44PM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM EDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues along the Beaver River. * WHERE...A portion of central New York, including the following county, Lewis. * WHEN...Until 500 AM EDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding along the Beaver River is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1032 PM EDT, the gauge at Croghan on the Beaver River was at 6.1 feet. The Beaver River is expected to crest around midnight, and then drop to around 5 feet at daybreak Thursday morning. This will result in flooding in low-lying areas along the river. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Croghan, Castorland, Kirschnerville, Belfort, Beaver Falls and Soft Maple Reservoir. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
